meanings.definition: Capable of being torn or lacerated.
meanings.sent1: The paper was so thin and lacerable that it tore easily.
meanings.sent2: She avoided wearing the lacerable fabric to prevent accidental tears.
meanings.sent3: The lacerable wrapping paper seemed to rip itself open in excitement.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt lacerable, torn apart by the harsh words.
meanings.sent5: The fragile bridge was lacerable, ready to break under any weight.

meanings.definition: Susceptible to being cut or wounded.
meanings.sent1: The delicate skin on her hands was lacerable and prone to cuts.
meanings.sent2: The soldier wore armor to protect his lacerable body in battle.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked lacerable, as if a single touch could slice through it.
meanings.sent4: Her trust was lacerable, easily wounded by betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The old book's pages were lacerable, showing signs of wear and tear.
